channel.title: Database question
channel.description:
The source I am running is RSCD, in the sql database there is a category named "rscd_players". In this category it has information such as usernames, current coordinations, whether or not the player is banned, etc. There is also information that confirms whether or not a player is logged in or not under the "loggedin" row. 0 = offline and 1 = online, I have made a simple php code that simply displays the name of a character if their loggedin status is set to "1", but when players log in the loggedin status stays as 0. Therefore my script does not show anyone online when there really is.
My question is: How would I fix this problem so that when someone logs onto my server the digit under the "loggedin" row will change from "0" to "1".[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 16, 2009, 09:27:59 pm[/size][hr]lul owned

item.title: Database question
item.dc:creator: @Shob Shob
item.description:
@Shob wrote:

Its a simple mysql query you can run when they loggin… and when they logout its just the oppisite.

Read full topic

you need to write the code into the login server.

item.title: Database question

item.description:
@liquidazer wrote:

yeah stays at 0, wanting it to atleast change to something different.

Read full topic

item.title: Database question
item.dc:creator: @aaronsc aaronsc
item.description:
@aaronsc wrote:

look at someone who is offline and make sure their status is still 0, if it goes to 1 when they are logged off, change it to 0, save. When they log in it should change back to 1, and then off and on. If that doesn’t fix it then i’m not sure, sorry, and best of luck

Read full topic
